keyword: how many calories in sweet potato fries
title: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato Fries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in sweet potato fries per 100 g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
h1: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato Fries?
assumptions: Oven-baked sweet potato fries, cut into 1/4-inch strips, lightly coated with 1 tsp oil per 100 g, no added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato size, oil amount, cooking method (baked vs. fried), and seasonings. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of oven-baked sweet potato fries contains about 150 kcal and 25 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Deep-fried in oil (vs. baked) per 100 g
Add 1 tbsp ketchup per 100 g serving

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Approximately 150 kcal for oven-baked with minimal oil.

faqs.q: Are sweet potato fries healthier than regular fries?
faqs.a: Yes, they offer more fiber (4 g per 100 g) and vitamins, but calories depend on oil used.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: About 25 g carbs per 100 g, including 4 g fiber and 7 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: Do sweet potato fries have protein?
faqs.a: Low amount, around 2 g per 100 g; pair with protein sources for balance.

faqs.q: How does frying affect calories in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Deep-frying can add 100+ kcal per 100 g due to absorbed oil.
